div.p: I think university is the biggest turning point in my life because you've grow up in care, you’ve always had to jump through loops
and answer to people, you’ve lost your home because of some trivial reason or you know you’ve got to sort of play by somebody else’s rules
whereas at university you’ve got your sort of independence and you follow your own rules and you have your own sense of cause and effect
you’re responsible for yourself so if you don’t pay your rent that’s your problem and you’re responsible for it; I’ve never had that problem
but you know there’s been things that I know I’m responsible for, you take ownership of what you do and every decision you make
will affect you whereas in care it’s like, I don’t know, it’s just not really the same and it’s very empowering being at university
and being independent I think that’s the best turning point I’ve got.
